meanings.definition: Not saturated; having the capacity to dissolve more of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The unsaturated solution could still absorb more sugar.
meanings.sent2: The chef added more salt to the unsaturated broth.
meanings.sent3: The sponge was so unsaturated, it eagerly soaked up the spilled juice.
meanings.sent4: Her unsaturated enthusiasm for learning was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The unsaturated soil eagerly drank up the rain, leaving no puddles behind.

meanings.definition: Not containing all the hydrogen atoms that the maximum number of carbon atoms can bond to.
meanings.sent1: The unsaturated fats in the avocado are healthier than saturated fats.
meanings.sent2: Cooking oil is often unsaturated and better for your heart.
meanings.sent3: The unsaturated molecules were like shy wallflowers at the chemistry party.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity flowed like unsaturated oil, smooth and unrestricted.
meanings.sent5: The unsaturated bonds in the molecule were like open arms, ready to embrace more atoms.
